publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-903# Irene Oldfather: Carrick - City of Adelaide—That the Parliament notes the proposed demolition of the Carrick – City of Adelaide, the world’s oldest clipper ship and the only vessel in Scotland to be an "A" listed structure; regrets that such an important part of Scotland, Sunderland and South Australia’s national and international maritime heritage should be in such a position, and believes that every effort should be made to secure a future for the vessel.
S1M-903# Carrick - City of Adelaide (lodged on 23 May 2000) Mr Brian Monteith*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Michael Russell*, Mr Jamie Stone*

S1M-903# Irene Oldfather: Carrick - City of Adelaide—That the Parliament notes the proposed demolition of the Carrick – City of Adelaide, the world’s oldest clipper ship and the only vessel in Scotland to be an "A" listed structure; regrets that such an important part of Scotland, Sunderland and South Australia’s national and international maritime heritage should be in such a position, and believes that every effort should be made to secure a future for the vessel. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Mr Jamie Stone, Allan Wilson*
S1M-903# Carrick - City of Adelaide (lodged on 23 May 2000) David Mundell*, Donald Gorrie*, Ms Sandra White*, Andrew Wilson*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Nora Radcliffe*, Rhoda Grant*
S1M-903# Carrick - City of Adelaide (lodged on 23 May 2000) Alex Neil*

Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Michael Russell, Mr Jamie Stone, Allan Wilson, David Mundell, Donald Gorrie, Ms Sandra White, Andrew Wilson, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Nora Radcliffe, Rhoda Grant, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*
